name: Shield Control
description:
Shield Control is a very simple infinite 2D Space shooter with a particlar mechanic: you have a Shield and you need to match its color to the enemy projectiles. If you do so, your shield will be recharged. If you allow a different-colore projectile / enemy to hit the shields, the shields will be severely damaged. 
If the shields go down, they will take a lot of time to recharge, so you will be in peril! The game features 3 different enemies, and 25 wave of increasingly difficult enemies. After the 25th, you'll be hit with a random "nightmare" wave each time, until the end of time (or until you die!). While the first 25 waves are pre-determined, the actual movement patterns will be random, which means each game session will be different from the last!

The game has been made as a small learning project.

Most of the art assets come from Kenney Assets, some have been created by me with Krita.

Audio sounds have been created by myself with sfxia.

The music has been created by

Dark Walk by Kevin MacLeod
Link: https://incompetech.filmmusic.io/song/3612-dark-walk

Have fun!
